title: Finance Manager Job at Alan & Grant
content:
Alan & Grant - Our client is a hospitality conglomerate based in Nigeria with diverse business interests including restaurants, catering, snack food manufacturing, hotels, cinemas, and real estate development.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Finance Manager is responsible for overseeing all financial activities of the hotel, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, cash flow management, internal controls, and statutory compliance.
	The role ensures the financial health of the hotel, supports operational decision-making, and contributes to achieving the property’s revenue and profitability goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and manage financial budgets and forecasts
	Prepare and present financial reports to management
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations and hotel policies
	Analyze financial performance and provide recommendations
	Identify areas for cost reduction and implement cost-saving initiatives
	Analyze revenue streams and provide recommendations for growth
	Lead the annual budgeting process, collaborating with department heads to develop realistic and effective budgets
	Manage daily cash flow, ensuring optimal liquidity for hotel operations.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field
	7 - 10 years of experience in similar capacity
	Proven experience in a finance management role, specifically within the hotel or hospitality industry.
	Excellent communication and leadership abilities
	A Master's degree or professional accounting qualification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, CPA) is highly preferred.
	Proficiency in financial management software and hotel property management systems (PMS).

title: Automation Engineer Job at Worknigeria
content:
Worknigeria was established with a Singular Vision. To help the vast Nigerian workforce find meaningful jobs. We are also on a mission to upskill them in the best ways possible and help them grow with and within their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Automation Engineer
Job Location: Ogun
Employment Type: Shift Work

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Automation Engineer to support our plant's process automation and minimize losses due to process malfunctions. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Krones machines and a strong background in automation and process control.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the entire plant in process automation and loss minimization
	Provide corrective maintenance support in automation and process control
	Manage calibration activities, software modifications, and backups
	Assess and train technicians and operators in automation
	Develop and maintain a database of automation information
	Provide innovative ideas for continuous improvement


Requirements


	First Degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Process Control, or related field
	10+ years of experience in FMCG (bottling) industry with Krones machine expertise
	Membership of NSE and COREN certification
	Strong communication skills in English.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@worknigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resources Lead Job at Hobark International Limited
content:
Hobark International Limited (HIL) is the parent company of the Hobark group operating in the oil and gas industry. The company was incorporated in 1998, starting as a staffing agency based in Port Harcourt. Currently we have offices in 4 countries with our head office in Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Lead

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Type: Permanent/Full time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The HR Lead will provide high-level administrative and operational support across all HR functions, ensuring the smooth running  of day-to-day activities and processes within the HR department
	Develop and implement HR strategies and policies aligned with the company’s vision and goals.
	Manage end-to-end recruitment processes to attract, select, and retain top talent.
	Drive performance management processes including KPIs, appraisals, and development plans.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree in Social Science discipline or any other relevant field
	The ideal candidate is a seasoned HR professional with at least 8 years of experience in administration, performance management, and generalist HR functions, ideally within the upstream oil & gas or similar sectors.
	HR certification (e.g. ACIPM, APHRI, HRCI) is an added advantage.
	Familiarity with labor laws and HR best practices in Nigeria.
	They must be proactive, highly organized, and capable of aligning HR strategy with business objectives. Strong expertise in recruitment, performance management, employee relations, compliance, and learning & development is essential.
	The candidate should possess excellent interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills, as well as proficiency in HR systems and Microsoft Office tools.
	The candidate must be detail-oriented, discreet, and able to work independently in a fast-paced, high-performance environment.
